message: Android Snippets is (obviously) a website to share and find good code snippets for the Android platform. It's been online since 2009, but has spent the last year as a static copy (after a server move and a crappy backend).
I've been working on a new version which runs on appengine for a while now, and relaunched the website two weeks ago. Would love to hear your feedback and ideas!
A star or bookmark icon might work

I quite like it.  I wasn't ever aware of it before now, so I don't have the static site to compare it to, but it's definitely useful, at least to me.  The design is simple, clean, effective.  If I could ask for 1 feature, it would be to request a 'favorite' this.  I'm sure there are many of these I'll revisit, and it's unlikely that they'll be on the front page when I do.
yeah this is nice, as an intermediate android developer it's a cool reference
@bmelton Great idea! Favorite's may be useful for a lot of visitors. Have to think about how to integrate it into the UI...
@num1 Glad you like it! Please feel invited to add snippets if you stumble across useful ones : )
They should be seperate. But a starred snippet should be counted as upvoted.
I've been thinking about adding a bookmark icon below the upvote
Another option would be to replace the upvote with a 'star' that could act as both -- a way to 'bookmark' snippets and a way to rank snippets. Thought?
It makes me very happy to hear that! :) I will continue to improve the site -- next ideas include bookmarks and the ability to get notified by email on new comments and edits
I'm an android developer and I REALLY like this idea. Good job -I bookmarked it and when I have free time I'll probably go through and see if I can add anything/comment on snippets.
